docstring.summary: Context-Fabric MCP Server.
docstring.description:
Context-Fabric MCP Server.

This package provides an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that exposes
Context-Fabric corpus operations to AI agents.

Usage:
    # Run as CLI
    cfabric-mcp

    # Or import and run programmatically
    from cfabric_mcp import mcp
    mcp.run(transport="stdio")

docstring.summary: Search result caching for Context-Fabric MCP server.
docstring.description:
Search result caching for Context-Fabric MCP server.

Caches search results by (corpus, template) to avoid re-running expensive queries.
All return_types (results, count, statistics, passages) can draw from the same cache.

docstring.summary: A cached search result.
docstring.description:
A cached search result.

Attributes:
    cursor_id: UUID for pagination/lookup
    corpus: The corpus name
    template: The search template
    results: Raw search results (list of node ID tuples)
    created_at: Unix timestamp when cached
    expires_at: Unix timestamp when cache entry expires
    last_accessed: Unix timestamp of last access (for LRU)

__init__.name: __init__
__init__.signature: (self, cursor_id: str, corpus: str, template: str, results: list[tuple[(int, ...)]], created_at: float, expires_at: float, last_accessed: float = {'arguments': [], 'cls': 'ExprCall', 'function': {'cls': 'ExprAttribute', 'values': [{'cls': 'ExprName', 'member': None, 'name': 'time'}, {'cls': 'ExprName', 'member': None, 'name': 'time'}]}})

docstring.summary: Update last accessed time.
docstring.description: Update last accessed time.

docstring.summary: Check if this cache entry has expired.
docstring.description: Check if this cache entry has expired.

docstring.summary: In-memory cache for search results.
docstring.description:
In-memory cache for search results.

Caches by (corpus, template) key. Different return_types and parameters
can reuse the same cached results.

Thread-safe for concurrent access.

__init__.name: __init__
__init__.signature: (self, default_ttl: int = 300, max_entries: int = 100, max_results_per_entry: int = 10000)

docstring.description:
Initialize the search cache.

Args:
    default_ttl: Default time-to-live in seconds
    max_entries: Maximum number of cached searches
    max_results_per_entry: Maximum results to cache per search

docstring.description:
Evict entries if cache is at capacity.

Uses LRU eviction strategy.

docstring.summary: Remove all expired cache entries.
docstring.description:
Remove all expired cache entries.

Returns:
    Number of entries removed

docstring.summary: Clear all cache entries.
docstring.description: Clear all cache entries.

docstring.summary: Get cached result by cursor ID.
docstring.description:
Get cached result by cursor ID.

Args:
    cursor_id: The cursor ID from a previous search

Returns:
    CachedSearchResult if found and not expired, None otherwise

get_or_execute.name: get_or_execute
get_or_execute.signature: (self, corpus: str, template: str, search_fn: Callable[([], list[tuple[(int, ...)]])], ttl: int | None = None)

docstring.summary: Get cached result or execute search and cache it.
docstring.description:
Get cached result or execute search and cache it.

Args:
    corpus: Corpus name
    template: Search template
    search_fn: Function to execute search if not cached
    ttl: Optional TTL override

Returns:
    CachedSearchResult with the search results

get_page.signature: (self, cursor_id: str, offset: int, limit: int)

docstring.summary: Get a page of results from a cached search.
docstring.description:
Get a page of results from a cached search.

Args:
    cursor_id: The cursor ID
    offset: Number of results to skip
    limit: Maximum results to return

Returns:
    Tuple of (results, has_more, total_count) or None if not found

docstring.summary: Corpus management for MCP server.

Corpus management for MCP server.

Handles loading and caching of corpora for the MCP server.
Supports multiple simultaneous corpora.

docstring.summary: MCP resource definitions for Context-Fabric.
docstring.description:
MCP resource definitions for Context-Fabric.

Resources provide read-only data that agents can access via URIs.

docstring.description:
Get corpus information as a resource.

URI: corpus://{corpus_name}

docstring.summary: Get list of features as a resource.
docstring.description:
Get list of features as a resource.

URI: corpus://{corpus_name}/features

docstring.description:

Get node type information as a resource.

URI: corpus://{corpus_name}/types

docstring.summary: FastMCP server for Context-Fabric.
docstring.description:
FastMCP server for Context-Fabric.

This module defines the MCP server that exposes corpus operations
to AI agents via the Model Context Protocol.

Transports:
- stdio (default): For Claude Desktop and local MCP clients
- sse (--sse PORT): Server-Sent Events for remote MCP clients (e.g., Cursor)
- http (--http PORT): Streamable HTTP for production deployments

Tool Set (10 tools):
Discovery:
- list_corpora: List available corpora
- describe_corpus: Corpus structure (node types, sections)
- list_features: Browse features with optional node_type filter
- describe_feature: Feature details with sample values
- get_text_formats: Text encoding samples (cached)
Search:
- search: Pattern search with return_type (results/count/statistics/passages)
- search_continue: Paginated search continuation
- search_syntax_guide: Search syntax docs (section-based)
Data Access:
- get_passages: Batch section lookup
- get_node_features: Batch feature lookup

Note: Usage guide is provided via MCP instructions field at connection time.

docstring.summary: Get corpus information.
docstring.description:
Get corpus information.

Returns detailed information about a loaded corpus including
node types, features, and statistics.

docstring.summary: Get corpus structure overview.
docstring.description:
Get corpus structure overview.

Returns node types and section structure. Use list_features() to browse
features, describe_feature() for details, get_text_formats() for encoding.

Args:
    corpus: Corpus name (defaults to current corpus)

Returns:
    Corpus overview including:
    - node_types: All node types with counts
    - sections: Section hierarchy levels

describe_feature.name: describe_feature
describe_feature.signature: (feature: str | list[str], sample_limit: int = 20, corpus: str | None = None)

docstring.summary: Get detailed info about one or more features.
docstring.description:
Get detailed info about one or more features.

Returns metadata, node_types, and sample values (by frequency).
Use list_features() first to browse available features.

Args:
    feature: Feature name or list of names (e.g., "sp" or ["sp", "vt"])
    sample_limit: Max sample values per feature (default 20)
    corpus: Corpus name (defaults to current corpus)

Returns:
    Feature details including:
    - name, kind, value_type, description
    - node_types: Which object types have this feature
    - unique_values: Count of unique values
    - sample_values: Top values by frequency with counts

docstring.summary: Get list of available features.
docstring.description:
Get list of available features.

Returns lists of node features and edge features available in the corpus.

get_node_features.name: get_node_features
get_node_features.signature: (nodes: list[int], features: list[str], corpus: str | None = None)

docstring.summary: Get feature values for a list of nodes.
docstring.description:
Get feature values for a list of nodes.

Batch lookup of feature values for multiple nodes.

Args:
    nodes: List of node IDs
    features: List of feature names to retrieve
    corpus: Corpus name (defaults to current corpus)

Returns:
    Feature values for each node.

get_passages.name: get_passages
get_passages.signature: (sections: list[list[str | int]], limit: int = 50, lang: str = 'en', max_override: bool = False, corpus: str | None = None)

docstring.summary: Get passages by section references.
docstring.description:
Get passages by section references.

Batch lookup of multiple sections at once.

Args:
    sections: List of section references, e.g., [['Genesis', 1, 1], ['Exodus', 2, 3]]
    limit: Maximum sections to return (default 50)
    lang: ISO 639 language code for section names (e.g., 'en' for English book names)
    max_override: Bypass limit cap. May produce large responses - use judiciously.
    corpus: Corpus name (defaults to current corpus)

Returns:
    List of passages with text and node information.

docstring.summary: Get text encoding samples showing original script and transliteration.
docstring.description:
Get text encoding samples showing original script and transliteration.

Returns format pairs with diverse samples. Use when constructing search
queries that need specific text encodings. Results are cached per corpus.

Args:
    corpus: Corpus name (defaults to current corpus)

Returns:
    Text format information with sample pairs.

docstring.summary: List all currently loaded corpora.
docstring.description:
List all currently loaded corpora.

Returns:
    Dictionary with 'corpora' list and 'current' corpus name.

list_features.name: list_features
list_features.signature: (kind: str = 'all', node_types: list[str] | None = None, corpus: str | None = None)

docstring.summary: List features with optional filtering.
docstring.description:
List features with optional filtering.

Returns lightweight catalog for discovery. Use node_types to filter by
object type. For full details with samples, use describe_feature().

Args:
    kind: Filter by "all", "node", or "edge"
    node_types: Filter to features for these types (e.g., ["word"])
    corpus: Corpus name (defaults to current corpus)

Returns:
    List of features with name, kind, value_type, description.

docstring.summary: Run the MCP server with configurable transport.
docstring.description: Run the MCP server with configurable transport.

docstring.summary: Get node information.
docstring.description:
Get node information.

Returns detailed information about a specific node including
type, text, section reference, and slot positions.

search.name: search
search.signature: (template: str, return_type: str = 'results', aggregate_features: list[str] | None = None, group_by_section: bool = False, top_n: int = 50, limit: int = 100, max_override: bool = False, corpus: str | None = None)

docstring.summary: Search for patterns in the corpus.
docstring.description:
Search for patterns in the corpus.

Args:
    template: Search template (use search_syntax_guide() for syntax help)
    return_type: What to return:
        - "results": Paginated node info with cursor (default)
        - "count": Just total count
        - "statistics": Feature distributions per matched node position
        - "passages": Formatted text grouped by section
    aggregate_features: For statistics: which features to aggregate
    group_by_section: For statistics: include distribution by book
    top_n: For statistics: max values per feature (default 50)
    limit: For results/passages: page size (default 100)
    max_override: Bypass limit cap. May produce large responses - use judiciously.
    corpus: Corpus name (defaults to current corpus)

Returns:
    Search results formatted according to return_type.
    For "results", includes cursor for pagination via search_continue().

search_continue.name: search_continue
search_continue.signature: (cursor_id: str, offset: int = 0, limit: int = 100, max_override: bool = False)

docstring.summary: Continue a paginated search using a cursor ID.
docstring.description:
Continue a paginated search using a cursor ID.

Use this to get additional pages of results from a previous search.
Cursors expire after 5 minutes.

Args:
    cursor_id: The cursor ID from a previous search
    offset: Number of results to skip
    limit: Maximum number of results to return (default 100)
    max_override: Bypass limit cap. May produce large responses - use judiciously.

Returns:
    Next page of search results with updated cursor.

docstring.summary: Get documentation on search template syntax.
docstring.description:
Get documentation on search template syntax.

Call without args for summary + available sections. Call with section
name to get detailed content for that topic.

Args:
    section: Optional section name (basics, structure, relations,
             quantifiers, examples). None returns overview.

Returns:
    Without section: summary + list of available sections.
    With section: detailed content for that section.

docstring.summary: Get node type information.
docstring.description:
Get node type information.

Returns information about all node types including counts and node ranges.

docstring.summary: MCP tool implementations for Context-Fabric.
docstring.description:
MCP tool implementations for Context-Fabric.

Tools are functions that agents can execute to interact with corpora.

_format_passages.name: _format_passages
_format_passages.signature: (api: Any, results: list[tuple[(int, ...)]], template: str, limit: int)

docstring.summary: Format search results as readable passages.
docstring.description: Format search results as readable passages.

_format_results.name: _format_results
_format_results.signature: (api: Any, results: list[tuple[(int, ...)]], template: str, cursor_id: str, limit: int)

docstring.summary: Format search results as paginated node info.
docstring.description: Format search results as paginated node info.

_format_statistics.name: _format_statistics
_format_statistics.signature: (api: Any, results: list[tuple[(int, ...)]], template: str, aggregate_features: list[str] | None, group_by_section: bool, top_n: int)

docstring.summary: Format search results as statistics with feature distributions.
docstring.description: Format search results as statistics with feature distributions.

docstring.summary: Get corpus structure overview.
docstring.description:
Get corpus structure overview.

Returns node types, section structure, and feature counts.
Use list_features() to browse features, describe_feature() for details,
and get_text_formats() for text encoding samples.

Args:
    corpus: Corpus name (defaults to current corpus)

Returns:
    Corpus overview with node types, sections, and feature counts.

describe_features.name: describe_features
describe_features.signature: (features: str | list[str], sample_limit: int = 20, corpus: str | None = None)

docstring.summary: Get detailed info about one or more features.
docstring.description:
Get detailed info about one or more features.

Returns sample values (by frequency) and statistics for each feature.
Use after describe_corpus() to explore specific features.

Args:
    features: Feature name or list of feature names (e.g., "sp" or ["sp", "vt", "vs"])
    sample_limit: Max sample values to return per feature (default 20)
    corpus: Corpus name (defaults to current corpus)

Returns:
    For single feature: Feature details dict
    For multiple features: Dict keyed by feature name with details for each

docstring.summary: Get detailed information about a loaded corpus.
docstring.description:
Get detailed information about a loaded corpus.

Args:
    corpus: Corpus name (defaults to current corpus)

Returns:
    Detailed corpus information including node types, features, and section structure.

get_node_features.name: get_node_features
get_node_features.signature: (nodes: list[int], features: list[str], corpus: str | None = None)

docstring.summary: Get feature values for a list of nodes.
docstring.description:
Get feature values for a list of nodes.

Args:
    nodes: List of node IDs
    features: List of feature names to retrieve
    corpus: Corpus name (defaults to current corpus)

Returns:
    Feature values for each node.

get_passages.name: get_passages
get_passages.signature: (sections: list[list[str | int]], limit: int = 50, lang: str = 'en', max_override: bool = False, corpus: str | None = None)

docstring.summary: Get passages by section references.
docstring.description:
Get passages by section references.

Args:
    sections: List of section references, e.g., [['Genesis', 1, 1], ['Exodus', 2, 3]]
    limit: Maximum sections to return (default 50)
    lang: ISO 639 language code for section names (e.g., 'en' for English book names)
    max_override: Bypass limit cap. May produce large responses - use judiciously.
    corpus: Corpus name (defaults to current corpus)

Returns:
    List of passages with text and node information.

docstring.summary: Get text format samples showing how text is encoded in this corpus.
docstring.description:
Get text format samples showing how text is encoded in this corpus.

Returns original script and transliteration pairs with diverse samples.
Use this when you need to understand text encoding for search queries.
Results are cached per corpus.

Args:
    corpus: Corpus name (defaults to current corpus)

Returns:
    Text format information with samples.

list_features.name: list_features
list_features.signature: (kind: str = 'all', node_types: list[str] | None = None, corpus: str | None = None)

docstring.summary: List all features with optional filtering.
docstring.description:
List all features with optional filtering.

Returns a lightweight catalog of features for discovery.
Use node_types to filter by object type. For full details including
sample values, use describe_feature().

Args:
    kind: Filter by feature kind - "all", "node", or "edge"
    node_types: Filter to features that apply to these object types (e.g., ["word"])
    corpus: Corpus name (defaults to current corpus)

Returns:
    List of features with name, kind, value_type, and description.

docstring.summary: List all currently loaded corpora.
docstring.description:
List all currently loaded corpora.

Returns:
    Dictionary with 'corpora' list and 'current' corpus name.

search.name: search
search.signature: (template: str, return_type: str = 'results', aggregate_features: list[str] | None = None, group_by_section: bool = False, top_n: int = 50, limit: int = 100, max_override: bool = False, corpus: str | None = None)

docstring.summary: Search for patterns in the corpus.
docstring.description:
Search for patterns in the corpus.

Args:
    template: Search template (see search_syntax_guide for syntax)
    return_type: What to return - "results", "count", "statistics", or "passages"
    aggregate_features: For statistics: which features to aggregate (default: all low-cardinality)
    group_by_section: For statistics: include distribution by section (book/chapter)
    top_n: For statistics: max values per feature distribution (default 50)
    limit: For results/passages: page size (default 100)
    max_override: Bypass limit cap. May produce large responses - use judiciously.
    corpus: Corpus name (defaults to current corpus)

Returns:
    Search results formatted according to return_type.

search_continue.name: search_continue
search_continue.signature: (cursor_id: str, offset: int = 0, limit: int = 100, max_override: bool = False)

docstring.summary: Continue a paginated search using a cursor ID.
docstring.description:
Continue a paginated search using a cursor ID.

Args:
    cursor_id: The cursor ID from a previous search
    offset: Number of results to skip
    limit: Maximum number of results to return (default 100)
    max_override: Bypass limit cap. May produce large responses - use judiciously.

Returns:
    Next page of search results.

docstring.summary: Get documentation on search template syntax.
docstring.description:
Get documentation on search template syntax.

By default returns a summary with available sections.
Call with section='relations' (or basics/structure/quantifiers/examples)
to get detailed info on a specific topic.

Args:
    section: Specific section to retrieve (basics, structure, relations,
             quantifiers, examples). Default: returns summary.

Returns:
    Summary with section list (default) or specific section content.
